episodes.title: Gone with the Window
episodes.plot: Twelve new queens compete to be America's Next Drag Superstar. The queens must reinvent their drag looks using only a set of curtains and household items.

episodes.title: Starrbootylicious
episodes.plot: The dolls make it rain when they compete as burlesque dancers at a hot Hollywood nightclub and weather an unexpected twist.

episodes.title: Country Queens
episodes.plot: The queens split off into teams to film a country-fried commercial directed by Kathy Najimy who's joined on the panel by guest judge country music legend Tanya Tucker.

episodes.title: The Snatch Game
episodes.plot: The dolls compete in a star-studded TV game show where they must pull out their best celebrity impersonations. Guests include actor Alec Mapa, red carpet diva Phoebe Price & guest judges comedienne Niecy Nash and actress Lisa Rinna.

episodes.title: Here Comes the Bride
episodes.plot: Wedding bells ring as the queens go from blushing brides to dragzillas in a challenge that weds their drag personas with the perfect grooms...themselves.

episodes.title: Rocker Chick
episodes.plot: The queens rock out on the main stage when they're challenged to sing live for the first time ever in RuPaul's Drag Race history.

episodes.title: Once Upon a Queen
episodes.plot: The dolls must sell their tales as they pose for a book cover photo shoot and hit the press junket circuit. E!'s Marc Malkin is joined by best-selling authors Jackie Collins & Gigi Levangie Grazer & Absolut Vodka's Jeffrey Moran.

episodes.title: Golden Gals
episodes.plot: The queens must transform a group of silver daddies into their drag mothers in this NYX Cosmetics challenge. They're joined by guest judges Debbie Reynolds & Cloris Leachman as well as NYX Cosmetics founder Toni Ko.

episodes.title: The Diva Awards
episodes.plot: The final four queens hit the red carpet and pull out all the stops as they create looks for three separate divalicious award shows. Guest judges include Academy Award winner Tatum O'Neal and Tony Award winner Marissa Jaret Winokur.

episodes.title: The Main Event Clip Show
episodes.plot: RuPaul reviews the highlights of season two via a clip montage.

episodes.title: Music Video Finale
episodes.plot: The final three contestants: Tyra, Raven and Jujubee must perform a dramatic scene before cameras, create a vintage 80s look, and perform in RuPaul's music video "Jealous of my Boogie" before revealing the season two contest winner.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.plot: After Tyra Sanchez has been announced winner of the Season Two drag contest, RuPaul reunites the entire Season Two cast to reflect on some past occurrences and confront issues some contestants still harbored for each other and the judges.
